posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
I was going to name a character Thorin II Oakenshield until I saw that he liked to play the harp.  I figure I would make a build with bard in it.  I
thought he would be a fighter bard DD but I could not find such a build.  Thoughts??

David

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Fighter 6/ Bard 16/ Dwarven Defender 18 for the most amount of damage reduction, plus a strong Bard song. You take four levels of Fighter pre-epic and just two more in epic for the EWS.

You start/ finish with something like that for ability scores,  STR 16 (26)  DEX 13  CON 18 (22)  INT 13  WIS 08  CHA 06

You won't have the ability to cast any Bard spells but you can use whatever arcane scrolls/ wands you liike for buffing because you are an arcane caster already and the most important thing is your Bard/ Curse song anyway. This build will get you EDR III as well offering 21/ -- Damage Reduction plus the usual Defensive Awareness, Dodge, Uncunny Dodge and Defensive Stance. Stance/ Song/ Curse and Dodge alone will give you something like +12 armour class over and above, what a normal full tumble warrior already has and with the amount of HP's you will have plus Defensive Awareness plus 21 points of Damage Reduction will make you a very hard nut to crack. AB will be relatively low (40) unbuffed but with Bard Song/ Curse Song it essentially is +7 from what shown on paper.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content: You think I should start with Bard or fighter??

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
A Dwarven Defender is required to be lawful, but a Bard is forbidden to be lawful, so you will need to be able to change your alignment at will.
If you are starting with less than 11 CHA, you cannot start with Bard.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You start as Fighter,

Pre- epic levels you go with (Fighter 4/ Bard 6/ Dwarven Defender 10) to maximize your saves. Post- epic you finish with another (Fighter 2/ Bard 10/ Dwarven Defender 8) levels.
